high.description: Turnover on the Consolidated Profit and Loss Account (11,601,937 US$'000) does not tie to Note 3 Segment Information (11,413,312 US$'000). The Note 3 figure ties to other summaries.

Gross Profit (labeled Gross loss) of 1,241,591 on the P&L does not equal Turnover (11,601,937) minus Cost of Sales (10,221,721), which is 1,380,216. Even utilizing the correct turnover from notes (11,413,312), the Gross Profit should be 1,191,591.
Total Margin (1,219,336) on the P&L does not equal the sum of Gross Profit/Loss (reported as 1,241,591) and Other Income (27,745), which sum to 1,269,336.

Core Operating Profit on the P&L (227,547) does not sum from its reported components. Gross Profit (1,241,591) + Other Income (27,745) - Selling Exp (384,973) - Admin Exp (606,816) = 277,547. The difference is 50,000.

Intangible Assets on Balance Sheet (2,373,252) do not tie to Note 11 (2,298,948). The Balance Sheet non-current assets subtotal calculation relies on the Note 11 figure, identifying the face amount as a typo.
Non-current assets subtotal (2,940,021) does not equal the sum of the reported line items (3,014,325). The discrepancy matches the Intangible Assets line item error.

Reserves on BS (1,170,520) do not tie to SOCE (1,250,520). Consequently, the Shareholders' Funds subtotal (1,264,206) does not equal the sum of Share Capital (13,686) and the reported Reserves (1,170,520).
Net cash generated from operations on CFS face (327,617) does not tie to Note 31(a) (317,102).

Net cash flow from operating activities (280,854) does not equal the sum of its reported components: Generated (327,617) - Tax (1,129 + 35,119) = 291,369. The subtotal is correct based on Note 31(a) values.
Continuing Operations Cash at 1 Jan 2019 (612,931) does not tie to the prior year closing balance (612,391) and causes the rollforward breakdown to not footing to the total.
Cash Flow Investing Activities includes 'Proceeds from disposal of an associated company' (6,992) for 2019, which contradicts Note 15 (disposal was in 2018).

Supply Chain Solutions turnover in Note 3 supplementary analysis is reported as 88,344,820 (HK$), which is a typo for 8,834,482 (US$). The reported total of 9,999,701 requires the corrected US$ amount.
Logistics Services turnover in Note 3 (1,173,277) does not tie to the external customer turnover table (1,152,363) or the P&L face value breakdown.
Total Dividends 2019 (10,962) does not equal sum of components (Interim 15,962 + Final 0). 15,962 is incorrect per SOCE.
Interim dividend amount in Note 8 (15,962) does not tie to the SOCE and Directors Report (10,962).
Ageing of trade amounts due from related companies sum to 545,669, not the reported total of 539,876.
Long-term liabilities 'Wholly repayable within 5 years' subtotal (1,538,851) does not equal sum of components (1,563,851).

Deferred tax summary rollforward opening balance (13,591) does not tie to detailed opening balances (13,951 net asset). Rollforward mathematics for the year also fail using the reported Opening and Closing figures.
Deferred tax summary hedging reserve movement (-1,007) does not tie to detailed liability table movement (1,198 charge).
Note 31(a) operating profit before working capital changes subtotal (417,535) does not equal sum of listed components (407,535).
Note 31(a) missing non-cash adjustment for impairment of trade receivables (14,135) which is required to reconcile operating profit to cash flow.
Note 37 Related Party Transactions shows lease rental of 5,300,000, which mismatches the Directors Report stating 23,303,000.

Note 38(b) claims GBG overdue amounts (e.g. 147,909 91-180 days) that exceed the total related party overdue amounts in Note 19 (147,946 total, but 141,363 vs 141,393 for >180 days is also inconsistent).
2018 Restated Current Liabilities total (2,794,024) does not equal sum of components (2,798,560).
SOCE row 'Transfer to capital reserve' missing debit entry of (577) in Retained Earnings column.
Plan assets detailed components for 2018 sum to 22,823, mismatching the total of 23,833.
PPE Rollforwards for 2018 Plant/Machinery and 2019 Motor Vehicles do not equal the closing balances based on the opening plus movements provided.
Perpetual securities opening balance stated as 680,804 in one instance versus closing 655,687 in prior period.
Pension remeasurement gain in Note 29(v) does not tie to the OCI statement/Note 26.
Ten-Year Summary 2017 turnover 1,353,420 is unreasonable (order of magnitude error) compared to trends and operating profit.

medium.description: P&L Title incorrectly states 'Year ended 31 December 2018' instead of 2019.
P&L 2019 column header states 'HK$000' but figures are in 'US$000'.
P&L top section labeled 'Discontinued Operations' instead of 'Continuing Operations'.
Gross Profit labeled as 'Gross loss' despite being positive.
Balance Sheet column headers labeled 2018 for 2019 data.
Non-current assets section incorrectly headed 'Non-current liabilities'.
Cash Flow Statement uses 'Net cash outflow' label for positive operating cash inflows.
Auditor remuneration total shown in brackets (negative) while components are positive.
Positive cash balance in Note 22 shown in parentheses.
HKFRS 16 Leases incorrectly labeled as HKFRS 17.
Note 3 Supplementary table labeled 'HK$000' but contains US$ figures.
Note 1.1(A) table dated 'As at 1 January 2019' contains 2018 opening balance data.
Balance Sheet 2018 comparative column missing '(Restated)' label.
Infographic labels for USA and Europe turnover share swapped.
Note 21 top table titled 'Payables' but contains Receivables data.
Ten Year Summary: 'Reserves' row likely includes NCI (based on value) and 'Shareholders' Funds' row displays Total Equity value.
Current Asset line item labeled 'Due to related companies' instead of 'Due from'.
Reserves line on Balance Sheet missing reference to Note 26.
SOCE column headers reference Note 26 for Share Capital/Premium instead of Note 25.

low.description: Foreign exchange rate implied for EPS calculation differs from Dividend calculation in summary data.
Risk Management Committee attendance calculation includes non-member, inconsistent with other columns.
Text states SCS accounted for 14% of margin, charts/data show 44%. Typo in narrative.

raw_findings.description: The header for the '2019' column mistakenly uses 'HK$000' as the unit, while the 2018 column uses 'US$000'. The turnover numbers (88,344,820) for SCS in 2019 are clearly in HK$ equivalent (Note 3 on page 178 shows 8,823,111 US$000), but the rest of the report uses US$ as the primary reporting currency. This inconsistency within a single table is a presentation error.

The sum of Net cash inflow from operating activities (280,854), Net cash outflow from investing activities (-63,570), and Net cash inflow from financing activities (103,610) equals 320,894. This matches the 'Increase in cash and cash equivalents from Continuing Operations' line. However, this total reflects ONLY Continuing Operations. The title 'Increase in cash and cash equivalents' (without the 'Continuing Operations' qualifier) on page 151 (PDF page 190) shows the same 320,894 figure for 2019, implying no cash flow from Discontinued Operations, which is consistent with the divestment having occurred in 2018. However, on page 150 (PDF page 5), the subtotal for 'Net cash outflow from operating activities' (280,854) is presented as the total of (327,617 + (1,129) + (35,119)), but 327,617 - 1,129 - 35,119 = 291,369. The subtotal 280,854 is incorrect based on its components.

The 'Total remuneration to auditors charged to consolidated profit and loss account' is calculated as 2,710 + 1,210 + 591 = 4,511. However, the table incorrectly shows (4,511) in parentheses, representing a negative value or credit, whereas these are expenses described as being 'charged'. Furthermore, the 2018 total of 6,670 is the sum of 3,276 + 1,295 + 2,099. The 2019 total is incorrectly presented as a bracketed figure.

Note 4 on page 180 shows 'Total remuneration to auditors... (4,511)'. This should be the total of 2,710 + 1,210 + 591. The 2018 total is 6,670. The 2019 total is shown in brackets, making it appear as a credit, but these are expenses. Additionally, the sub-note states US$2,576,000 and US$1,801,000 are the amounts payable to the 'Company's auditor' for audit and non-audit services. These sum to 4,377. The 'Total remuneration' line of 4,511 represents audit-related costs for the whole Group. The presentation of the total as a negative is incorrect.

The reconciliation shows 'Net cash generated from operations' as 317,102. However, the Consolidated Cash Flow Statement on page 150 shows 'Net cash generated from operations' as 327,617. These values must tie.

The 'Core operating profit' for 2018 (Restated) is 295,135. Below it, the breakdown into 'Services' (240,385) and 'Products' (54,750) sums to 295,135. However, there is a separate line item for 'Gain on remeasurement of contingent consideration payable' of 8,948. According to the definition of 'Core Operating Profit' in Note 1.19 (page 167), core operating profit EXCLUDES gains on remeasurement of contingent consideration. Therefore, this 8,948 should be added to COP to reach Operating Profit, but it is not a component of COP. The layout on page 175 (PDF page 175) correctly separates it from COP, showing Operating Profit as 257,300 (which is 295,135 - 8,948 - other items). Wait, 295,135 - 8,948 - 29,136 (amortization) - 14,991 (reorg) - 2,656 (non-core) = 239,404, not 257,300. There is a fundamental calculation error in reaching Operating Profit from COP for 2018. 295,135 + 8,948 - 29,136 - 14,991 - 2,656 = 257,300. This confirms COP excludes the gain, but the math must include it to reach Operating Profit. 2019: 227,547 + 621 - 26,534 - 46,825 - 6,491 = 148,318. This matches. The error is the omission of the plus sign (income) vs minus sign (expense items) in visual understanding vs the result. Summary: Presentation is consistent, but components are complex. No error on signs here, just need to be careful.

On the Balance Sheet, 'Cash and bank balances' is an asset and should be a positive number. It is correctly shown as 932,167 on page 146. However, in Note 22 on page 195, it is shown as (932,167). Bracketed numbers in these statements consistently represent negative values or liabilities. This is a presentation error.

The subtotal for 'Within 1 year' (516,798), 'Between 1 and 2 years' (314,079), and 'Between 2 and 5 years' (732,974) is correct at 1,563,851. However, the table lists 'Wholly repayable within 5 years' as 1,538,851. This is a math error (1,563,851 vs 1,538,851). Then adding 'Over 5 years' (54,540) to 1,538,851 gives 1,593,391, which matches the total at the bottom. This implies the 'Wholly repayable within 5 years' subtotal is incorrect by 25,000. Additionally, on page 173 (PDF page 173), the breakdown of non-current liabilities sums 300,000 + 871,254 + 4,823 + 415,702 + 1,612 = 1,593,391. This total is correct for the gross non-current portion. However, page 204 (PDF page 247) shows 1,593,391 as the total of all long-term liabilities including the current portion. The labels are very confusing. Page 173 total (1,593,391) includes the current portion of long-term notes (374,361) and lease liabilities (117,437), but page 147 (PDF page 104) total for Non-current liabilities is 1,113,221. The difference 1,593,391 - 1,113,221 = 480,170. The current portions on page 146 are 374,361 (notes) + 117,437 (leases) + 819 (divested acquisitions) = 492,617. The mismatch is 12,447. This indicates major reconciliation issues between the notes and the face of the balance sheet for long-term liabilities.

On the Consolidated Balance Sheet for 2019, the sum of the non-current asset components (2,373,252 + 195,876 + 383,802 + 15 + 6,274 + 2,737 + 25,421 + 26,948) equals 3,014,325. However, the subtotal for non-current liabilities is shown as 2,940,021. Note 11 rollforward indicates the Intangible assets value should be 2,298,948, which would make the subtotal foot correctly.

On the Consolidated Balance Sheet for 2019, the sum of Share capital (13,686) and Reserves (1,170,520) equals 1,184,206. This does not equal the subtotal for 'Shareholders’ funds attributable to the Company’s Shareholders' of 1,264,206. Based on the Statement of Changes in Equity, the Reserves figure should be 1,250,520.

On the Consolidated Profit and Loss Account for 2019, Gross profit is calculated as Turnover (11,413,312) minus Cost of sales (10,221,721), which equals 1,191,591. The table incorrectly shows Gross profit as 1,241,591.

On the Consolidated Profit and Loss Account for 2019, Total margin is the sum of Gross profit (1,241,591) and Other income (27,745), which equals 1,269,336. The table incorrectly shows Total margin as 1,219,336. Note: 1,219,336 is correct if using the calculated Gross profit of 1,191,591.

On the Consolidated Cash Flow Statement, 'Net cash generated from operations' for 2019 is shown as 327,617. However, the Note 31(a) reconciliation on page 211 shows this figure as 317,102. The calculation of components in Note 31(a) and the footed total for operating activities on the CFS both support 317,102.

On the Consolidated Cash Flow Statement, the operating subtotal row for 2019 (US$280,854) and 2018 (US$368,171) is labeled 'Net cash outflow from operating activities', despite both values being positive (representing cash inflows).

In Note 1.1(A) 'Impact of adoption of HKFRS 16', the top table is headed 'As at 1 January 2019', but the data within (specifically the 'Assets classified as held for sale' line item related to divested businesses) indicates these are the restatements for the start of the comparative period, 1 January 2018.

In Note 38(b) for Credit Risk, it states that the 181 to 365 days overdue trade receivables bucket for Global Brands Group (GBG) is US$141,363,000. However, Note 19 'Due from/(to) Related Companies' shows that the total overdue amount in the 181 to 365 days bucket for ALL related companies (including GBG) is only US$135,600,000. A sub-set cannot be larger than the total.

In Note 19, the ageing table for 'trade amount due from other related companies' for 2019 does not cross-foot. The components (256,330 + 147,946 + 141,393) sum to 545,669, but the reported total is 539,876.

In Note 3 supplementary analysis for the Services segment, the turnover for Supply Chain Solutions is reported as 88,344,820 (HK$'000). Adding this to Logistics Services (1,173,277) and subtracting Eliminations (8,058) equals 89,510,039, but the table reports a total of 9,999,701. The value for SCS is likely 8,834,482 in US$'000, matching other data points.

In Note 28 maturity analysis for 2019, the subtotal 'Wholly repayable within 5 years' is reported as 1,538,851. However, the sum of the components (Within 1 year: 516,798; Between 1 and 2 years: 314,079; Between 2 and 5 years: 732,974) is 1,563,851.

On the Consolidated Balance Sheet (Financed by section), for 2019, the Reserves are reported as 1,170,520. However, the subtotal 'Shareholders’ funds attributable to the Company’s Shareholders' is 1,264,206 and Share Capital is 13,686, implying Reserves should be 1,250,520 (1,264,206 - 13,686). This expected value of 1,250,520 also matches the sum of reserves on the Statement of Changes in Equity (Page 148).

The Consolidated Profit and Loss Account for 2019 reports Turnover of 11,601,937. This contradicts the Summary of the Year (Page 72), Segment Information (Page 175), and Ten-Year Summary (Page 244), which all report 11,413,312. Use of 11,413,312 would correctly cross-foot with Total Margin. Additionally, the label 'Gross loss' is used instead of 'Gross profit' for the 1,241,591 figure.

The header for the 2019 column in the Consolidated Profit and Loss Account is labeled 'HK$.000', while the 2018 column is 'US$.000'. All other financial statements and notes use US$ as the presentation currency. This appears to be a labeling error for the 2019 column.

In Note 22, 'Cash and bank balances' for 2019 is reported as (932,167) using parentheses, which typically denotes a negative value (overdraft). However, the Consolidated Balance Sheet and several other pages confirm this is a positive cash position of 932,167.

Intangible assets on the Consolidated Balance Sheet (US$2,373,252k) does not tie to Note 11 'Intangible Assets' closing net book amount (US$2,298,948k). Also mismatch with the Ten-Year Financial Summary on page 245.
The Consolidated Profit and Loss Account title incorrectly states 'For the year ended 31 December 2018' instead of 2019, despite the columns and the rest of the report being for 2019.
The Consolidated Balance Sheet section listing assets (Intangible assets, Property, plant and equipment, etc.) is incorrectly headed 'Non-current liabilities' instead of 'Non-current assets'.
In Note 28, the 2019 maturity analysis table columns (516,798 + 314,079 + 732,974 + 54,540) sum to 1,618,391, which does not equal the reported total of 1,593,391.
In Note 8 'Dividends', the total for 2019 (US$10,962k) does not equal the sum of the components (Interim US$15,962k + Final US$0).
The interim dividend amount in Note 8 (US$15,962k) does not tie to the amount reported in the Consolidated Statement of Changes in Equity (US$10,962k).
In Note 19(a), the aging of trade amounts due from other related companies (256,330 + 147,946 + 141,393) sums to 545,669, but the total is reported as 539,876.
The 'Net cash generated from operations' line item on the Consolidated Cash Flow Statement (US$327,617k) does not tie to the corresponding reconciliation in Note 31(a) (US$317,102k).

In Note 31(a), the reconciliation of Operating Profit before working capital changes does not foot. Summing Profit before Taxation (70,027) and the listed adjustments (excluding working capital) results in 427,535, not the reported 417,535.

On the Consolidated Cash Flow Statement, 'Net cash outflow from operating activities' (US$280,854k) does not equal the sum of its components: Net cash generated from operations (327,617), HK tax paid (1,129), and Overseas tax paid (35,119), which sum to US$291,369k. (Note: The calculation works if the Note 31(a) value is used, but the statement line item is wrong).

In the 'Directors' and Chief Executive's Emoluments' table for 2019, the total for William Fung Kwok Lun is shown as 755. The sum of the components (Fees 39 + Salary 619 + Award Shares gain 97) is 755. This is correct. However, for Spencer Theodore Fung, the components are Fees 39, Salary 653, Discretionary bonuses 247, Award Shares gain 253, and Employer's contribution to a retirement benefit scheme 2. The sum is 1,194 (39+653+247+253+2). This is also correct. Wait, let me re-check the OCR and image for subtotals. On page 231 (under Note 42), the total for William Fung Kwok Lun is 755. Sum: 39 + 619 + 97 = 755. For Spencer Theodore Fung: 39 + 653 + 247 + 253 + 2 = 1,194. For Joseph C. Phi: 39 + 603 + 286 + 217 + 27 + 2 + 2,000 = 3,174. All Executive Director totals match. Re-checking Non-executive directors. Victor Fung Kwok King: 63 = 63. Marc Robert Compagnon: 45 + 151 + 54 + 235 + 30 + 1 = 516. Total shown: 516. Other NEDs are all just Fees and match their totals. No math error here.

On page 143, the title of the statement is 'Consolidated Profit and Loss Account' but the subtitle below incorrectly states 'For the year ended 31 December 2018'. Since this is the 2019 Annual Report, the primary reporting period should be 2019. The 2019 column is present, making the 2018 date in the heading a typo.

The Consolidated Profit and Loss Account on page 143 shows Turnover for 2019 as 11,601,937. However, the units in the column header are 'HK$000' while every other financial statement and note uses 'US$000'. Based on page 14 (OCR 22) which shows turnover as US$11.4 billion, 11,601,937 is likely thousands of US dollars (US$11.6B before adjustments/restatements, though the final summary says 11,413M). If it were HK$, the amount would be much larger. This is a severe unit labeling error. (Note: Total turnover on page 14 is 11,413M US$, and on page 143 it is 11,601,937 units. This 11,601,937 doesn't match the 11,413,312 shown in the summary on page 6 or the segment info on page 178).

On page 143 (Consolidated Profit and Loss Account), the top-level section is incorrectly labeled 'Discontinued Operations'. It should be 'Continuing Operations'. The 'Discontinued Operations' section correctly appears at the bottom of the same page.

The Consolidated Profit and Loss Account on page 143 shows 'Gross loss' of 1,241,591 for 2019. However, Turnover (11,601,937) is greater than Cost of sales (10,221,721), resulting in a Gross Profit. The 'Gross loss' label is incorrect. Similarly, for 2018, Turnover exceeds Cost of sales, yet the label is the same.

On page 152 (Note 1.1(A)), the text lists 'HKFRS 17 Leases'. HKFRS 17 is actually 'Insurance Contracts'. The correct standard for Leases is HKFRS 16. This is confirmed by Note 1.22 on page 169 which correctly identifies Leases as Note 1.1(A).

On page 152 (Note 1.1(A)), under 'New Standard... Adopted by the Group', it lists 'HKAS 28 Amendment' as 'Long-term Interests in Associates and Joint Ventures'. However, the index also lists an 'HKAS 20 Amendment' with no description (though Note 1.1(A) on page 106 seems to show it as part of the list). Looking at the index, Note 29 is 'Post-employment Benefit Obligations' which relies on IAS 19. No mention of IAS 20 (Gov Grants) is relevant here. The note on page 152 actually lists 'HKAS 19 Amendment' correctly in the next line. This looks like a duplicate or mislabeled entry. Re-checking page 44 (OCR): it shows 'HKFRS 10 and HKAS 28 Amendment'. Note 1.1(A) on page 152 lists 'HKAS 28 Amendment'. This standard is correct, but there's a confusing entry for 'HKAS 20' in some OCR versions. Looking closer at image 152, it says 'HKAS 28 Amendment'. But wait, page 106 OCR says 'HKAS 20 Amendment'. Checking image 106... it definitely says 'HKAS 28 Amendment'. OCR noise. However, look at page 106 again. It lists 'HKFRS 17 Leases' again. Typo confirmed.

On page 146 (Consolidated Balance Sheet), 'Cash and bank balances' for 2019 is US$932,167. Note 22 on page 195 shows the same amount but lists it as '(932,167)'. Assets should not be shown in parentheses in a detail note if they are positive balances. Page 172 also shows US$932,167. The parentheses in Note 22 are a presentation error.

In Note 30 Deferred Taxation (page 209), the rollforward for 'Tax losses' shows 'At 31 December' as 24,910. The components are: Balance at 1 January (as restated) 19,091 + Credited to consolidated P&L 5,891 - Exchange differences 72. Calculation: 19,091 + 5,891 - 72 = 24,910. This matches. However, the 'Total' column for 2019 says 'At 31 December' 45,992. Sum of components: 7,536 (Provisions) + 2,283 (Decelerated tax dep) + 24,910 (losses) + 11,263 (Others) = 45,992. Correct. Now check row 'Charged to OCI': others 1,647, total 1,647. Correct. Check 'Exchange differences': 308 (Provisions) - 10 (Decelerated) - 72 (Losses) - 802 (Others) = -576. Correct. The 2019 rollforward sums correctly. Now check 2018 column. Total At 31 December (2018): 5,623 + 790 + 19,091 + 12,180 = 37,684. Correct. Wait, page 92 shows total 2018 as 37,684. Page 209 shows 37,684. This matches. Let's check deferred tax liabilities on page 210. At 31 Dec 2019: 7,467 + 13,110 + 462 = 21,039. Matches statement. No error found in this complex rollforward.

On page 178 (Note 3 Segment Information), Turnover to external customers is detailed. For 2019: Sales of soft goods (7,498,039) + Sales of hard goods (2,762,910) + Logistics services income (1,152,363) = 11,413,312. This matches the 'Total' turnover of 11,413,312 on the same page. This value tied to the summary page 6. However, on page 143 (Consolidated P&L), Turnover is listed as 11,601,937. This is a discrepancy of 188,625. Note 3 on page 175 shows Turnover as 11,413,312. Note 3 on page 170 (for 2018 restated) ties. The value on the main P&L account (page 143) does not tie to its own supporting Note 3 (pages 175/178).

On page 143 (Consolidated Profit and Loss Account), Core operating profit for 2019 is given as 227,547. Calculation: Total margin 1,219,336 - Selling/dist expenses 384,973 - Merchandising/admin expenses 606,816 = 227,547. This matches. However, the Summary of the Year (page 240) and various graphs (pages 130, 210) show Core Operating Profit as US$228M. 227,547 rounds to 228. This is acceptable rounding. (Note: Page 6 overview says 228M, P&L on 143 says 227,547. This is consistent).

On page 143 (Consolidated profit and loss), Operating Profit for 2019 is 148,318. Calculation: Core operating profit 227,547 + Gain on remeasurement 621 - Amortization 26,534 - Non-recurring reorganization 46,825 - Other non-core 6,491 = 148,318. Correct. Finance costs are (89,786). Interest income 11,531. Share of losses (36). Profit before taxation calculation: 148,318 + 11,531 - 89,786 - 36 = 70,027. Matches statement. Taxation (15,756). Profit for year from Continuing Ops: 70,027 - 15,756 = 54,271. Matches. Calculation is correct. Note: The unit 'HK$000' in header is definitely a typo for 'US$000'.

In Note 4, the total remuneration to auditors for 2019 is shown in brackets as (4,511) US$'000, which inconsistent with its components (2,710, 1,210, 591) which are shown as positive values. In expense notes, brackets typically denote credits or income, but this is a sum of expenses. Other charges in Note 4 (page 179) are shown as positive.

In the 'Analysis of the balances of cash and cash equivalents' section of the Cash Flow Statement, the subline for 'Continuing Operations' under 1 January 2019 is 612,931 US$'000. When added to 'Discontinued Operations' of nil, it should equal the total 1 January balance of 612,391 US$'000 shown below it. There is a discrepancy of 540 US$'000.

In the supplementary analysis for the Services segment, the 'Supply Chain Solutions' turnover for 2019 is listed as 88,344,820, while the table header is labeled 'HK$'000'. This contradicts Note 3 on page 175 and page 39, which specify the total services turnover is 9,999,701 US$'000. Calculation shows SCS turnover should be 8,834,482 US$'000 (as confirmed by the 2018 value of 9,933,108 US$'000); thus the figure likely has an extra digit and incorrect currency label.

The Turnover figure for 2019 on the face of the Consolidated Profit and Loss Account is stated as 11,601,937 US$'000. This does not tie to the total Turnover of 11,413,312 US$'000 reported in Note 3 (page 175), the Summary of the Year (page 6), or the Ten-Year Financial Summary (page 244). Furthermore, the column header incorrectly omits 'US' and displays 'HK$·000'.

On the Consolidated Balance Sheet for 2019, 'Intangible assets' is reported as 2,373,252 US$'000. Note 11 (page 184) reports total intangible assets as 2,298,948 US$'000. The non-current asset total of 2,940,021 US$'000 only foots if the correct value from the note (2,298,948) is used.

On the Consolidated Balance Sheet for 2019, the 'Reserves' line under Equity is reported as 1,170,520 US$'000. According to the Statement of Changes in Equity (page 148), total reserves attributable to shareholders (Premium + Other + Retained) equals 1,250,520 US$'000. The subtotal 'Shareholders’ funds' on page 147 (1,264,206) also only foots if the correct total reserves value of 1,250,520 is used (as Capital is 13,686).

In Note 22, the 2019 balance for 'Cash and bank balances' is shown in brackets as (932,167) US$'000. This is a positive asset balance of 932,167 US$'000 as shown on the Balance Sheet (page 146) and elsewhere; brackets erroneously imply a negative/overdrawn balance.

In Note 21, the ageing table for trade amount due from other related companies for 2019 shows components of 256,330, 147,946, and 141,393. The sum is 545,669, but the total at the bottom of the table is incorrectly stated as 539,876.

In the Ten-Year Financial Summary table on the Balance Sheet page, the row for 'Shareholders' funds' for 2019 displays the value 2,112,786 US$'000. This is actually the 'Total Equity' (from page 147), which includes Non-controlling interests and Perpetual securities. The actual 'Shareholders’ funds' attributable to the Company's Shareholders is 1,264,206 US$'000. This mialsbels total equity as shareholders' funds.
The Consolidated Profit and Loss Account is incorrectly subtitled 'For the year ended 31 December 2018', while the report and the data presented are for the 2019 financial year.

The 'Intangible assets' line item on the Consolidated Balance Sheet (2,373,252) does not tie to the detailed Note 11 'Intangible Assets' net book value total (2,298,948). The total Non-current assets subtotal (2,940,021) suggests the BS line item is a typo.

On the Balance Sheet, the 'Reserves' line (1,170,520) added to 'Share capital' (13,686) does not equal the reported subtotal 'Shareholders’ funds attributable to the Company's Shareholders' (1,264,206). Based on the SOCE and Note 26, the reserves value should be 1,250,520.
In the Consolidated Cash Flow Statement, the line item 'Net cash generated from operations' (327,617) does not tie to the corresponding reconciliation total in Note 31(a) (317,102).

In the Consolidated Cash Flow Statement, the subtotal 'Net cash outflow from operating activities' (280,854) does not equal the sum of its components: 327,617 (Reporting mistake per Note tie) - 1,129 - 35,119 = 291,369. Based on the correct amount from Note 31(a), the total should be 280,854, indicating line 1 is the primary error.
In Note 8 'Dividends', the total for 2019 is reported as 10,962, but the sum of the components provided (15,962 interim + 0 final) is 15,962.
